channel.title: Jingyi Cui's website
channel.description: Recent content on Jingyi Cui's website

item.title: The majority of Canadian citizen is not satisfied with the performance of the federal government under Justin Trudeau
item.description: Abstract Using the phone survey from 2019 Canadian Election Study, we investigated whether the participants are satisfied with the performance of the federal government under Justin Trudeau. By plotting the response of the quenstionaire, we discover that \(54.3\%\) of the participants is not satisfied with the performance. This suggests that Justin Trudeau will lost some votes in the new election. Introduction We used the dataset of the phone survey from 2019 Canadian Election Study to investigate the satisfactory level of the adult Canadian citizens to the performance of the federal government under Justin Trudeau.

item.title: A Plain Markdown Post
item.description: This is a post written in plain Markdown (*.md) instead of R Markdown (*.Rmd). The major differences are: You cannot run any R code in a plain Markdown document, whereas in an R Markdown document, you can embed R code chunks (```{r}); A plain Markdown post is rendered through Blackfriday, and an R Markdown document is compiled by rmarkdown and Pandoc. There are many differences in syntax between Blackfriday’s Markdown and Pandoc’s Markdown.

item.title: About
item.description: This is a “hello world” example website for the blogdown package. The theme was forked from @jrutheiser/hugo-lithium-theme and modified by Yihui Xie.

item.title: Introduction
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.

item.title: support code
item.description: library(tidyverse) ## ── Attaching packages ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.3.0 ── ## ✓ ggplot2 3.3.2 ✓ purrr 0.3.4 ## ✓ tibble 3.0.3 ✓ dplyr 1.0.2 ## ✓ tidyr 1.1.2 ✓ stringr 1.4.0 ## ✓ readr 1.3.1 ✓ forcats 0.5.0 ## ── Conflicts ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── ## x dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() ## x dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() library(visdat) library(cesR) library(skimr) library(dplyr) get_ces("ces2019_phone") ## TO CITE THIS SURVEY FILE: ## ## - Stephenson, Laura B; Harell, Allison; Rubenson, Daniel; Loewen, Peter John, 2020, '2019 Canadian Election Study - Phone Survey', https://doi.
